causes.heading: YOUR HAIR LOSS DOESN'T HAVE TO BE LEFT TO CHANCE.
causes.subheading: Men's hair thins for more than one reason. And addressing multiple causes is exactly what Hr² was designed to do.
causes.stress_body: Chronic stress can disrupt healthy hair cycles and influence shedding patterns.
causes.hormones_body: Hormonal signals can affect follicle sensitivity and contribute to long-term thinning.
causes.dht_body: Sleep, activity, and habits influence regeneration and the environment hair needs to grow.
causes.nutrition_body: Nutrient gaps that can arise from diet or an imbalanced gut microbiome.
causes.aging_body: With increasing age, growth phases can become shorter – making it harder to maintain hair density.
causes.caption: The body needs nutrients to nourish and support a healthy hair growth cycle. These nutrients can be reduced, for example, by an unbalanced diet – which can affect hair strength and overall health.

faq.q2: Does Hr² work for my hair type?
faq.a2: Hr² is designed for daily, long-term hair health support – regardless of hair type or texture. Since the causes of hair loss and thinning vary (e.g., nutrient status, stress, hormones, genetic factors), results may vary individually.
faq.q3: Does it work for both women and men?
faq.a3: Yes. Hr² is designed for both women and men and supports hair health regardless of gender. Since causes and starting points (e.g., nutrient status, stress, hormones, genetics) are individual, results may vary.
faq.a4: No. Hr² is a food supplement and contains no medicinal drugs. It provides selected ingredients such as vitamins, minerals, plant extracts, and amino acids for daily support.
faq.q5: I know some hair growth treatments have side effects. Does that apply to Hr² as well?
faq.a5: As a food supplement, Hr² is generally well tolerated. As with all supplements, individual intolerances may occur (e.g., gastrointestinal discomfort). If you experience any issues, pause use and consult a doctor – especially if you have pre-existing conditions, are pregnant/breastfeeding, or are taking medication.
faq.q6: Is there a risk that Hr² lowers libido?
faq.a6: Hr² contains no medicinal drugs and is not intended to interfere with hormones. Individual reactions are still possible – if you notice changes, pause use and consult a medical professional.
faq.q7: Does Hr² cause unwanted hair growth on other body parts?
faq.a7: Hr² is designed to support overall nutrient supply and hair health – not to specifically promote body hair. Since hair growth is biologically complex, individual effects may vary.
faq.q8: Is Hr² certified by independent third parties?
faq.a8: We place great value on quality assurance and test both raw materials and finished products as part of our quality controls. If you need specific certifications or test documents, please contact our support team.
faq.q9: Is Hr² approved by the EMA?
faq.a9: Hr² is a food supplement. Food supplements are generally not 'approved' by the EMA like pharmaceutical drugs. Classification and requirements depend on the respective market and applicable regulatory standards.
faq.q10: Can I take Hr² together with other hair support products and supplements?
faq.a10: Generally yes, but watch out for double dosages (e.g., zinc, biotin, or other micronutrients) and the recommended daily amount. If you're taking medication or have health concerns, it's best to discuss the combination with your doctor or pharmacist.
faq.q11: Does Hr² help with genetic hair thinning?
faq.a11: Genetics often play a major role in hair thinning. Hr² can support nutrient supply and hair health, but does not replace medical diagnosis or therapy. If you notice significant or increasing hair thinning, a consultation with a dermatologist is recommended.
